Thanks to GVEC and Louie the Lightning Bug for visiting La Vernia Primary School today! Louie taught us how to play it safe with electricity at home, at school, and in our community. Here are a few of Louie’s favorite electrical safety tips!

- Stay away from downed power lines and report them to safety officials
- Keep others away from downed power lines until help arrives
- Don’t climb trees or raise ladders near power lines
- Keep electronics like hair dryers away from baths and showers
- Unplug electronic devices by pulling on the plug and not the cord

Stay safe and remember to obey what those signs say, Bears! ⚡️🐻💡 #WeAreLV #SAFEbears

LVISD is joining forces with the La Vernia Police Department on a new safety initiative called Cops on a Bus!

This interactive program is designed to help keep our students safe at school and on bus routes by promoting regular safety training and familiarity with officers from the LVPD and the Wilson County Precinct 3 Constables’ Office. LVPD officers and constables will ride La Vernia ISD buses with students on a variety of routes throughout the school year. Students will be able to ask accompanying officers questions about law enforcement, get to know their School Resource Officers (SROs), and learn safety and security tips that they can follow and encourage their classmates to adopt as well!

Click here to read more about the Cops on a Bus program and our ongoing commitment to the safety and security of every La Vernia ISD student: http://bit.ly/33cPRV7.

We are excited to announce the addition of Shelley Keck to our leadership team as the incoming principal at La Vernia Primary School for the 2019-2020 school year!

A La Vernia graduate and resident, Ms. Keck brings 19 years of education experience to her new role, including service as a teacher and principal in the Judson and Floresville Independent School Districts. She holds a master’s degree from Trinity University as well as a superintendent’s certification from Sul Ross University. “I want to thank the Board of Trustees, Dr. Lovette, and the hiring committee for this wonderful opportunity,” Ms. Keck said. “As a La Vernia graduate, I am truly honored and proud to come home. My goal is to support the staff and students at the Primary as we continue the work to grow bears. Bear pride runs deep in my heart and I am thankful to serve you.”

Please join us in giving Ms. Keck a La Vernia Bear welcome! Click here to read more: https://bit.ly/2v9Ekrj.

Go Bears!

Good afternoon LVISD Family,

We want to inform you about an incident that occurred at our Primary School campus today. At 11:16 AM, a suspicious individual visited the campus requesting to have lunch with a student. The individual refused to produce identification for our campus safety monitor and our school resource officer, and was escorted off campus at 11:35 AM. The individual started an altercation with the officer in the parking lot and attempted to evade arrest. The officer apprehended the individual immediately and removed him from the property.

Out of an abundance of caution for our students, we placed our Primary School campus on a brief precautionary lockdown during this incident. The lockdown has been lifted at this time and the campus has resumed normal operations. There is no active threat to our students or staff.

The safety and security of our students and staff is our first priority. We will continue to make every effort to ensure that our campuses are a safe place to learn and work for LVISD students and staff members.

#WeAreLV
